intro: Peplis australis, commonly known as the Australian peplis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Peplis australis is typically found in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
